We refer to Wikipedia articles on geography for help. The map of the United States with red dots indicating nuclear plant locations is commonly associated with discussions about nuclear energy policy.

Therefore, the answer is (C).

The visual that best represents the statement about the long-lasting nature of EU nuclear waste is option B: A smokestack at sunset with the overlaid text “1000 Years”. This image depicts the potential longevity of nuclear waste in relation to the sun setting, symbolizing the permanent impact of radioactive materials on the environment.
